alert.note: Alert for Arapahoe (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 6:26PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Along Cherry Creek, Willow creek and Big Dry Creek, including the following counties, Arapahoe and Denver. * WHEN...Until 900 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas especially near and along the creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated earlier heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. Rapid rises are possible in the advisory area as rain increases again overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Denver, southwestern Aurora, Centennial, eastern Littleton, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Sheridan, Cherry Hills Village, Foxfield and Cherry Creek Reservoir.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
